ships.name: Korath Warlord
ships.description: After gaining access to Sestor and Mereti technology, the Exiles have developed this new ship. Unlike the Palavret or Rano'erek, this is a true war machine.

ships.name: Prateskar 711
ships.description: An unfinished prototype under development by the Kor Sestor at the time their network was shut down. Its deployment into the Sestor fleets could have shifted the balance of power in their war with the Mereti.

ships.name: Model 1024
ships.description: The next step in the evolution of the Kor Mereti war-machine is the Model 1024, somewhat improved beyond a perfect ring. Sporting minimal armament with a sudden conversion to a cargo hauling vessel, this was obviously developed after the Kor Mereti gained sapience and diverted their focus to less self-destructive endeavors.

ships.name: Korath Forager
ships.description: Originally designed as a military scout, the Kor Efret have repurposed these interceptors for mining asteroids.

ships.name: Quarg Seakraken
ships.description: Despite their enormous population, civilian Quarg are seldom seen travelling from one of their rings to another via ships. When they need to do so, however, these massive transports are at their disposal. While most think of the Quarg as a peaceful species, the large number of weapon mounts on the Taniwha hint at its violent past as a troop carrier.

ships.name: Quarg Wardrake
ships.description: The Quarg use this as a small patrol and scouting vessel. They typically travel in squadrons escorting other Quarg vessels to prevent the theft of Quarg technology.

ships.name: Quarg Warwyvern
ships.description: The Warwyvern was used by the Quarg as a medium warship during times of war. Rarely seen among their fleets today, Warwyverns still remain on standby to defend Quarg ringworlds from external threats.

ships.name: Quarg Skyswift
ships.description: With over twice the cargo capacity of the largest human freighters, Skyswifts are old freighters the Quarg use mostly to transport materials in bulk.

ships.name: Garbage Scow
ships.description: The Garbage Scow is an ancient ship: developed hundreds of years ago to transport radioactive materials across human space, it had lost importance with the introduction of generalised and better armed haulers like the Bulk Freighter and the Behemoth. Some still operate legitimately, carrying waste away to designated disposal sites. But many of these freighters have wound up in the hands of smugglers after the discovery that the internal structure of their Radiological Containment cylinders are very efficient at hiding cargo from being scanned.

ships.name: Modified Garbage Scow
ships.description: When the Radiological Containment cylinders on a Garbage Scow have been damaged beyond repair, removing them is often easier than finding a replacement. This transforms the Garbage Scow into a compact medium warship.

ships.name: Rukh
ships.description: A Firebird-based ship design produced at the Wei Shipyards centuries ago, the Rukh was a vessel that qualifies as a middle ground between medium and heavy warships. Betelgeuse Shipyards sued their competitor at Wei for patent infringement shortly after the Republic was formed. The court judgement left Wei Shipyards bankrupt and production of the Rukh abruptly ceased.

ships.name: Marauder Rukh
ships.description: After the discovery of the original blueprints for the Rukh, mechanics were able to combine that data with modern ship design principles to further optimize the design for combat.

ships.name: Tevah-Ark Coracle
ships.description: The Tevah-Ark Coracle is a mobile habitat store house of DNA samples for all the life forms once native to Korath space. Its deployment after centuries of being on standby brings hope for the Kor Efret to restoring the ruined Korath worlds.

ships.name: Ikatila'ej Eldar
ships.description: The microbot-powered grinder on this older model Ikatila'ej operates internally rather than taking in detritus directly from outside the ship. But this version of the ship is more durable than newer designs.

ships.name: Rai'alorej Makwar
ships.description: This militarized variant of the Rai'alorej-Class Refuge operates as a mobile medical center. It has many of the facilities found on the regular model. Missing are the incubators and nurseries intended for civilian use.

ships.name: Korath World Crafter
ships.sprite: ship/Midnight PR4987 korath refuge/Midnight PR4987 korath refuge
ships.description: The Korath World Crafter manufactures parts, medicine, medical equipment, and sufficient food for bare sustenance. Onboard, there are incubators, nurseries, and hospitals.

ships.name: Korath World Forger
ships.description: The World Forger is factory ship; a millennia-old ship design that has improved in every generation. At the height of the Korath war, these ships created drones and clouds of combat nanites. Today, its facilities produce basic living supplies and ship parts.

ships.name: Korath World Shaper
ships.description: The Korath Exiles built these vast ships as their main population centers. In addition to living space, each Korath World Shaper has industrial and hydroponics capacity sufficient for bare subsistence of its inhabitants.

ships.name: Avialae
ships.description: The Avialae is an early example of Remnant ship development. Its design function still has traces of principles from ancestral human space. As they acclimated to life in the Ember Wastes many Prefects determined that mass production of big Utility ships was a waste of resources. Instead they chose to focus on filling their fleets with smaller, more specialized, models.

ships.name: Ekfar Tek 23
ships.description: This freighter is used by new Kor Sestor colonies to harvest and transport raw materials.

ships.name: Korbatar Makwar
ships.description: One of the last great Korath battleships from the height of the war that drove their species to near extinction, the Korbatar Makwar is an engine of destruction that dominates conventional battlefields. 	The number of these battleships which are still in operation can be counted on one hand. Korath shipyards are fully capable of assembling more Korbatar Makwars, but the exile from Korath space has forced them to prioritize construction of Korsmanath A'awojs and other support vessels instead. A small, but vocal, group of Navarchs continue to lobby various planning committees for construction of new Korbatar Makwars. But the civilian government refuses to capitulate to their demands.

ships.name: Modified Cargo Star
ships.description: The Cargo Star was a proprietary freighter used by Starwell Shipping Corporation before it was bought out by the Syndicate in a hostile corporate takeover. Many of the technologies and design principles from this ship can be found in the modern designs of Syndicate Shipyards. 	Most Cargo Stars that survived the Alpha Wars did so by having extensive modifications made to strengthen their hull, shields, and weapon capacity.

ships.name: Korath Scouter
ships.description: The Sku'uta is a Korath reconnaissance ship intended for quick forays into hostile territory.

ships.name: Magpie
ships.description: Shortly after development of the Starling, Remnant ship crafters attempted to apply the design principles they learned towards a medium warship. The Magpie was one functional result of this endeavor. 	There was an unforeseen problem with trying to apply the alien cloaking technology they had access to with a bigger ship: a noticeable increase in consumption of energy and fuel. Until the shipyards solve this problem, larger ships with cloaking will remain a rare sight in Remnant fleets. 	The cloaking technology is built into the Magpie's hull; it cannot be removed or transferred to another ship.

ships.name: Locust
ships.description: The Locust is a drone designed by the Syndicate for use in its security fleets. It has enough weapon space to install a pair of Energy Blasters while engine space is too limited for anything other than the Syndicate's own 1050 Ion Engines.

ships.name: Ogopogo
ships.description: The Ogopogo is a rare variant of the Leviathan heavy warship. It is slower than normal Leviathans, weighed down by thick layers of additional armor and shield emitters. Half the cargo bay has been altered to launch drones. And somehow, an extra gun port was jammed into the ship's prow, allowing it to carry another weapon into battle.

ships.name: Wretched Hive
ships.description: The Wretched Hive is a Protector that was heavily modified by pirates to act as a carrier. The gun ports were removed while the remaining internal weapon circuitry was rerouted through the cargo bay to make space for housing a swarm of drones. Thick armor plating has been added to the hull while additional engine space was made available to offset the added mass and drag.

variants.name: Korath Warlord (Korath Warlord (Prototype))
variants.description: After gaining access to Sestor and Mereti technology, the Exiles have developed this new ship. Unlike the Palavret or Rano'erek, this is a true war machine.

variants.name: Model 1024 (Model 1024 (Greenhouse))
variants.description: The next step in the evolution of the Kor Mereti war-machine is the Model 1024, somewhat improved beyond a perfect ring. Sporting minimal armament with a sudden conversion to a cargo hauling vessel, this was obviously developed after the Kor Mereti gained sapience and diverted their focus to less self-destructive endeavors.

variants.name: Model 1024 (Model 1024 (Infested))
variants.description: The next step in the evolution of the Kor Mereti war-machine is the Model 1024, somewhat improved beyond a perfect ring. Sporting minimal armament with a sudden conversion to a cargo hauling vessel, this was obviously developed after the Kor Mereti gained sapience and diverted their focus to less self-destructive endeavors.

variants.name: Korath World Crafter (Kor Efret World Crafter)
variants.sprite: ship/Midnight PR4987 korath refuge/Midnight PR4987 korath refuge
variants.description: The Korath World Crafter manufactures parts, medicine, medical equipment, and sufficient food for bare sustenance. Onboard, there are incubators, nurseries, and hospitals.

variants.name: Korbatar Makwar (Korbatar Makwar (Efret Upgrade))
variants.description: One of the last great Korath battleships from the height of the war that drove their species to near extinction, the Korbatar Makwar is an engine of destruction that dominates conventional battlefields. 	The number of these battleships which are still in operation can be counted on one hand. Korath shipyards are fully capable of assembling more Korbatar Makwars, but the exile from Korath space has forced them to prioritize construction of Korsmanath A'awojs and other support vessels instead. A small, but vocal, group of Navarchs continue to lobby various planning committees for construction of new Korbatar Makwars. But the civilian government refuses to capitulate to their demands.

variants.name: Magpie (Magpie (Grave Digger))
variants.description: Shortly after development of the Starling, Remnant ship crafters attempted to apply the design principles they learned towards a medium warship. The Magpie was one functional result of this endeavor. 	There was an unforeseen problem with trying to apply the alien cloaking technology they had access to with a bigger ship: a noticeable increase in consumption of energy and fuel. Until the shipyards solve this problem, larger ships with cloaking will remain a rare sight in Remnant fleets. 	The cloaking technology is built into the Magpie's hull; it cannot be removed or transferred to another ship.

outfits.name: Scattershot Ammo Access Temporary License
outfits.description: After this is acquired it can be found in the Licenses area when at the outfitter.

outfits.name: Scattershot Ammo Tech License
outfits.description: This technical manual details how to manufacture Scattershot Ammo. Having this makes it possible for any outfitter to offer Scattershot Ammo even if it is normally not stocked there.

outfits.name: Korath Disruptor Gun
outfits.description: Korath Disruptors interfere with a ship's shields, allowing a ship's hull to be damaged even when shields are up. However, they do very little hull damage by themselves.

outfits.name: Vector Engine (Reality Class)
outfits.description: Endless skirmishes among the rival Korath forces have produced a mockery of the word efficiency. Although total power output is increased considerably, the waste energy is very nearly enough to offset the advantages.

outfits.name: Quarg Ranseur
outfits.description: The Quarg Ranseur has a longer range than the Skylance but is a less powerful beam weapon.

outfits.name: Quarg Skydagger
outfits.description: Older Quarg vessels are outfitted with this beam weapon instead of the more infamous Skylance.

outfits.name: Quarg Culverin
outfits.description: This multipurpose weapon deals incredibly high shield damage at short range before the shot changes into an incredibly fast, shield-piercing blast.

outfits.name: Fluxion Shield Generator
outfits.description: The first humans who met the Quarg thought that their technology worked on magic, and many even think so to this day. The mechanism by which this Quarg shield generator works is completely unknown to humanity, and the Quarg aren't interested in giving up their secrets.

outfits.name: Infimum Shield Generator
outfits.description: The first humans who met the Quarg thought that their technology worked on magic, and many even think so to this day. The mechanism by which this Quarg shield generator works is completely unknown to humanity, and the Quarg aren't interested in giving up their secrets.

outfits.name: Tachyon Core
outfits.description: Although humanity is now capable of producing antimatter in relatively significant quantities when compared to a thousand years ago, it is still nothing compared to the Quarg. The Quarg can produce enough antimatter to outfit every ship with an extremely efficient antimatter core, producing extreme amounts of energy with surprisingly little waste heat.

outfits.name: Korath Electro Shocker
outfits.description: The Korath began using ion based weaponry after plundering this technology from a rodent-like species they encountered to the west of their space.

outfits.name: Korath Shocker Turret
outfits.thumbnail: outfit/Midnight PR4987 korath heavy shock turret
outfits.description: Access to ion based weapons were essential to staving off the autonomous hordes which dominated the later stages of the Korath civil war.

outfits.name: Fuel Refiner
outfits.description: The Korath developed this giant fuel processor for capital ships that carry many of their fuel-guzzling outfits. It maintains a negative vacuum pressure, pulling gas into the ramscoops faster than a fuel processor would alone.

outfits.name: Korath Defense Drone
outfits.description: These flying defense drones are released when intruders board the ship. Once one intruder has been neutralized, a laser emitter with a 360 degree firing arc allows it to quickly switch targets without pausing to reorient itself.

outfits.name: Korath Shock-Strike
outfits.description: This weapon adds an ionic charge to Korath Grab-Strike projectiles, further incapacitating the targeted ship to prevent it from escaping.

outfits.name: Fuel Stabilizer
outfits.description: It can also be used during fuel transportation. In rare situations, a sudden change in temperature can cause fuel to expand or contract, resulting in burst fuel tanks. A Fuel Stabilizer can help protect fuel carried during transport by regulating its state as a solid, liquid, or gas.

outfits.name: Accelerator Cannon
outfits.description: The Accelerator Cannon is a relatively new addition to the Unfettered arsenal. Projectiles launched by this weaponized particle accelerator retain some electromagnetic properties, causing some disruption in the power systems of any target struck by them. Due to their immense space requirements, few Unfettered captains are willing to radically alter their ships existing loadout for accomodating this weapon.

outfits.name: "Biri Biri" Afterburner
outfits.description: This tiny afterburner is considered a relic from the past among many Hai. Only the Unfettered still use them.

outfits.name: Langrage Hyper-Launcher
outfits.description: At close range, the heaved langrage merely forces the enemy back. As the launch field collapses and the langrage returns fully to normal space, however, it is rent into a rapidly-expanding cloud of deadly projectiles.

outfits.name: Radiological Containment
outfits.description: These cargo storage cylinders are designed to contain hazardous radioactive waste. Their internal structure also interferes with incoming scans enough to almost completely block all of them.

outfits.name: Scattershot Ammo
outfits.description: Genesis ammunition, professionally manufactured by their industrial mass production factories, is a critical element to many of their weapons. Quality control measures at these facilities make them less likely to jam.

outfits.name: Scattershot Rack
outfits.description: Scattershot Racks are used to store extra ammunition for Scattershot Guns.

outfits.name: Scattershot Depot
outfits.description: The Scattershot Depot stages extra ammunition in your cargo bay for weapons that use Scattershot Ammo. The ammunition is ready to be withdrawn for use. Storing it this way uses more cargo space than if it were packed away in sealed crates. An extra crewmember is required to oversee maintenance of the ammunition.

outfits.name: Scattershot Gun
outfits.description: Genesis mechanical weapons technology is far ahead of their energy weapons development. The loading systems on them are less likely to jam compared to species that put more resources on developing their energy weapons.

outfits.name: Shock Wave Blaster Turret
outfits.description: Mounting only a single Shockwave Blaster, this older version of the Shock Wave Turret is a viable option for arming smaller ships.

outfits.name: Shock Wave Turret
outfits.description: Shock Wave Blasters are no longer utilized in modern Hai fleets, but have seen a resurgence among Unfettered raiders. Mounting two of these weapons on a rotating turret base is a recent Unfettered innovation.

outfits.name: Korath Waste
outfits.description: This irradiated industrial waste is a byproduct of Korath manufacturing processes.

outfits.name: Korath Waste Launcher
outfits.description: The factories on larger Korath world ships produce a tremendous amount of waste. This weapon takes the most dangerous irradiated waste and fires it as a projectile that is very effective against shields.
